channel.title: Portfolio on Nicola Rennie
channel.description: Recent content in Portfolio on Nicola Rennie

item.title: Rtistry
item.description: Overview Generative art is the practice of creating artwork using code. When the programming language of choice is R, it’s often termed Rtistry or aRt. The generative artwork below can be reproduced using my {aRt} package on GitHub, which you can install in R using: remotes::install_github("nrennie/aRt") library(aRt) You can also view my generative artwork on Instagram. Examples Attraction attraction(n=50000, a=-3, b=1, c=0.

item.title: #TidyTuesday
item.description: What is #TidyTuesday? #TidyTuesday is a weekly data challenge aimed at the R community. Every week a new dataset is posted alongside a chart or article related to that dataset, and ask participants explore the data. You can access the data and find out more here. Portfolio Below is a selection of my contributions to the #TidyTuesday challenge. All contributions and the code used to generate them can be found on GitHub.

item.title: Du Bois Challenge
item.description: What is the Du Bois Challenge? The Du Bois Challenge is part of a celebration of the data visualization legacy of W.E.B Du Bois which attempts to recreate the visualizations from the 1900 Paris Exposition using modern tools. Check out the challenge here. Who was W.E.B. DuBois? Born in 1868, William Edward Burghardt Du Bois was an activist, author, and scholar, being the first African-American to receive a doctorate from Harvard University.
